generated_description:
Let’s unpack what Laminate is all about. Founded in 2023 and hailing from the Y Combinator Batch W23, Laminate is making waves in the fintech space, particularly in the B2B realm. Their core offering? Simplifying the design, manufacturing, and fulfillment of physical debit and credit cards for issuers.

Imagine you're a company wanting to provide your own branded cards without the headache of dealing with complex issuing stacks. That’s where Laminate comes in. They partner with businesses to streamline this process, allowing issuers to maintain their existing card issuing systems while Laminate handles the physical aspects.

While details about their team and specific location are a bit sparse, Aaron Epstein stands as their Group Partner, which adds a layer of credibility and experience within the startup ecosystem.

For more on what they're doing, you can visit their website at [Laminate](https://www.uselaminate.com). They currently invite potential customers to join a waitlist, teasing the simplicity and efficiency they promise for card issuance.

In a nutshell, if you're looking to ease the complexities of issuing physical cards, Laminate might just be the fintech partner you need. They’re a fine example of how new startups can identify a niche in the ever-evolving landscape of financial technology.
